title: 113_hr384
content: The "Homes for Heroes Act of 2013" is the short title of this Act. It establishes a Special Assistant for Veterans Affairs in the Department of Housing and Urban Development. The "Homes for Heroes Act of 2013" establishes a Special Assistant for Veterans Affairs in the Department of Housing and Urban Development, responsible for ensuring veterans have fair access to housing and homeless assistance. The Special Assistant for Veterans Affairs in the Department of Housing and Urban Development is responsible for coordinating programs, serving as a liaison with the Department of Veterans Affairs, United States Interagency Council on Homelessness, and other organizations, and providing advice on sponsoring housing projects for veterans. The Special Assistant for Veterans Affairs in the Department of Housing and Urban Development is responsible for coordinating programs, serving as a liaison with the Department of Veterans Affairs, United States Interagency Council on Homelessness, and providing advice on housing projects for veterans. Additionally, they are tasked with assisting veterans in obtaining housing or homeless assistance, coordinating with other departments, and carrying out assigned duties. The position of Special Assistant for Veterans Programs in the Department of Housing and Urban Development will be terminated as per section 4(h)(2) of the Department of Housing and Urban Development Act. SEC. 3. ANNUAL SUPPLEMENTAL REPORT ON VETERANS HOMELESSNESS. The Secretaries of Housing and Urban Development and Veterans Affairs, along with the United States Interagency Council on Homelessness, must annually submit a supplemental report to Congress on veterans homelessness, including information on activities and data from the previous year. The Department of Housing and Urban Development provides assistance to homeless veterans through the housing choice voucher program for Veterans Affairs supported housing (VASH). The report includes details on the number of veterans assisted, their characteristics, and the entities administering the vouchers. Additionally, special considerations for veterans are summarized in public housing agency plans. The Department of Housing and Urban Development administers programs for homeless veterans, including the housing choice voucher program for Veterans Affairs supported housing (VASH). The report details the activities of the Special Assistant for Veterans Affairs, coordination efforts with the United States Interagency Council on Homelessness, and the cost of administering programs for veterans. The Committees of Congress specified in this subsection include the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs, the Committee on Veterans' Affairs, the Committee on Appropriations, and the Committee on Financial Services. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development and the Secretary of Veterans Affairs consider relevant information in assessing programs related to veterans. Passed the House of Representatives on May 15, 2013. Attest: KAREN L. HAAS, Clerk.
